title: A new (artificial) era for Google Photos
summary: Thanks to AI and XR, Google Photos is entering a new era of content creation - for better or worse.
body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_ZF42Sm4Gq0 This week, Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown dive into a suite of upcoming Google Photos features that could change how we create and remember our favorite moments. They discuss new AI-powered highlight video templates that automate editing, the controversial introduction of face-retouching tools, and the exciting prospect of reliving memories in a 3D spatial environment with a new generation of Android XR headsets. The Authority Insights Podcast is a new weekly show from the Android Authority team hosted by Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown. In each episode, weâ€™ll break down the latest exclusive reports, app teardowns, and leaks from the Android Authority team.

title: 4 reasons I chose a Galaxy Watch 8 over the Pixel Watch 4
summary: And would happily do it over and again!
body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority A smartwatch, to me, is a vital companion for my phone. It helps me effectively manage my low self-control to use the phone, while allowing me to stay on top of notifications and important calls. If you, like me, willingly stick with Android and want to access apps that sync with your phone directly on your wrist, then Wear OS is your best option. Therefore, the Galaxy Watch 8 and the Pixel Watch 4 are two of the best smartwatches with Wear OS you can buy. The Galaxy Watch 8 and the Pixel Watch 4 are both from distinct lots that may not typically appeal to the same kind of users. If you already own a Samsung phone, and donâ€™t mind sticking to the comparatively less restrictive ecosystem (than Appleâ€™s) , the Galaxy Watch is the way to go. If you cherish the best of Google and want the latest features â€” which will eventually trickle down to all devices â€” from Wear OS, the Pixel Watch 4 may be the right pick for you.

title: Itâ€™s the little things: 4 quality-of-life updates I want to see in Gemini
summary: The AI chatbot can be vastly improved with minimal effort.
body: Credit: Megan Ellis / Android Authority Gemini is one of my favorite apps, but thereâ€™s definitely room for improvement. I want to see changes, but Iâ€™m not talking about anything super substantial here. Sure, we all want tools like Gemini to be faster, more engaging, and 100% factual, but thatâ€™s not the point of this post. I want to highlight a few smaller changes that I personally want to see that would drastically elevate the experience with Googleâ€™s AI chatbot. Donâ€™t be weird, Gemini

title: This Android launcher goes all in on widgets, and I absolutely love it
summary: I came from Niagara and Iâ€™m not sure I want to go back.
body: Iâ€™ve used almost every major Android launcher in recent years, some for a few days for testing purposes and others for years as the backbone of my smartphoneâ€™s home screen. These launchers range from the now-deprecated Nova Launcher to hot new properties like Octopi Launcher . Through it all, Iâ€™ve settled on Niagara Launcher thanks to its minimalist, productivity-focused design, which Iâ€™ve thoughtfully integrated into my daily workflow. However, as readers know, Iâ€™m always ready to reevaluate my choices and consider better alternatives. Today, Iâ€™m exploring AIO Launcher . Although Iâ€™ve seen many users recommend this app across various online forums, I havenâ€™t spent much time exploring all its features. And wow, thereâ€™s a lot to uncover here. Not a smooth transition At its core, AIO Launcher is unlike any other home screen on the market. Itâ€™s decidedly different from traditional products like Nova Launcher and Smart Launcher, but I canâ€™t quite compare it to other niche launchers. The best way to describe it is as an amalgamation of Kvaesitsoâ€™s endless scrolling home screen and Niagara Launcherâ€™s app drawer, but this isnâ€™t a bang-on description.

title: Google Play spills the beans on what apps and games are coming to Android XR
summary: The Galaxy XR may not be out yet, but the Play Store isn't waiting around.
body: TL;DR A new Play Store section highlights apps and games built for Android XR. Titles spotted include Asteroid, Vacation Simulator, and NFL Pro Era. Virtual Desktop has also appeared, hinting at PCVR streaming support for the platform. The big Galaxy XR headset reveal is just around the corner, but Google seems unconcerned about syncing everything perfectly with Samsungâ€™s timing. A section on the Play Store has popped up showcasing â€œimmersive experiences made for your XR headset,â€ giving us a decent idea of whatâ€™s on the way for Android XR. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: The next version of Google Gemini could be just around the corner (Update: Maybe not?)
summary: An announcement could happen in the very near future.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR A leak may have revealed when Google plans to launch Gemini 3.0. The leak suggests weâ€™ll get an announcement on Oct 22, 2025. Update, October 17, 2025 (05:16 PM ET): It hasnâ€™t even been a week yet since we looked at this possible leak into a Gemini 3.0 ETA, and now a new source is throwing just a lot of cold water on those claims. The site Sources reports that contrary to what we just heard, Google will stick with the same December launch for Gemini 3.0 that it used for Gemini 2.0 and Gemini 1.0 before it.

title: That weird camera gimbal â€˜Robot Phoneâ€™ might actually go up for sale next year
summary: The hardware could be a lot further along than its AI-looking video suggested.
body: TL;DR Earlier this week, HONOR teased a phone with a unique camera gimbal arm. While the company said weâ€™d see more at MWC, the very AI-looking nature of the video left it unclear how far along this project is. A new source claims that work on the prototype is 80% complete. In 2025, telling the difference between whatâ€™s real and whatâ€™s not can feel like a Sisyphean task. Generative AI tools are becoming more sophisticated every day, and while lots of AI content is still easy to spot, who knows how much youâ€™re missing? Earlier this week we checked out one of the most impressive-looking phone hardware teasers weâ€™ve seen in a minute, but was it even real? Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Fairphone proves patience pays off with a surprise Android 15 jump
summary: Last yearâ€™s delay turns into an unexpected bonus for Fairphone 4 owners.
body: TL;DR The Fairphone 4 will skip Android 14 and jump straight to Android 15 in early November. According to the company, development sped up after last yearâ€™s Qualcomm-related delay. The update will roll out in batches, bringing the 2021 phone in line with its successors. Fairphone 4 owners have waited a long time for their next big software update, and in return for that patience, theyâ€™re getting more than they expected. The company has confirmed that itâ€™s skipping Android 14 entirely and going straight to Android 15 , with the rollout planned for early November. The announcement comes from a Fairphone employee on the companyâ€™s Community Forum , who said development has â€œsped upâ€ enough to make the jump possible. The update will roll out in batches, so donâ€™t worry if it doesnâ€™t appear on your phone right away.

title: Frustrated by your internet bill? AT&T is raising prices yet again
summary: After raising prices in 2023 and 2024, and posting $4.9 billion in quarterly profit, AT&T wants even more of your money.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR AT&T will raise home internet prices by $5/month starting December 1, 2025. The company attributes the price rise to rising operational costs, despite posting $4.9 billion in quarterly profit recently. New customers and low-income users in the Access from AT&T program wonâ€™t be affected. AT&T is raising the cost of its home internet plans once again, with the latest $5 monthly price hike set to take effect on December 1, 2025. The change was first spotted by users on Reddit , who began receiving notifications about the increase in their billing sections. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: These 5 apps died this year, and I already miss them dearly
summary: It's been a brutal few months for some of Android's once beloved apps.
body: Iâ€™ve encountered a bouquet of incredible new Android apps this year, from small utilities that bolster my productivity to genuine problem solvers that make the platform better. Not every Android app has or will survive to see the new year, though. As 2025 draws to a swift close and I scroll through the remaining apps pinned to my drawer, I canâ€™t help but remember those wares that once formed a core part of my Android experience and that were sunset this year. Many of these apps Iâ€™ve used religiously in the past, and Iâ€™ll certainly miss them going forward. Iâ€™ll miss these five dead Android apps in particular.

title: This is the the main upgrade I want to see on the Pixel 10a
summary: Ditch the plastic, Google.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority Iâ€™m in love with my Pixel 9a. I switched over to Googleâ€™s mid-ranger after using flagship phones for more than a decade, and I regret nothing. The phone has plenty of power, offers a brilliant software experience with seven years of updates, and is very affordable at its launch price of $500. However, there is one thing that bothers me about it. One thing Iâ€™d like Google to change with the Pixel 10a , and itâ€™s not what you think. I donâ€™t care for a larger display, the fancy camera setup from the Pixel 10 Pro , or anything else that will drastically increase the price. What I want is to get the feeling of a premium phone back, which I lost when I switched to the Pixel 9a.

title: Verizon-owned Total Wireless now has a free plan, though there are a few catches
summary: Partnerining with Lifeline, Total now has a totally free plan available only in California.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Total Wireless, a Verizon Value brand, is launching a free phone plan available only in California at first. The offer is limited to customers who qualify for the government Lifeline assistance program. The plan includes unlimited talk, text, and 6GB of high-speed data, with an $11 upgrade option for unlimited data. While Verizon is best known for its own network and services, its Value brands have become increasingly popular as well. This includes Total Wireless, a premium prepaid brand that offers limited in-store support, free streaming services on select plans, and plenty of other features that help it compare favorably to postpaid options. While its plans normally start around $40, thereâ€™s about to be a much more affordable option â€” one that will cost you nothing. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Harrowing home invasion footage reminds us to check for unknown Bluetooth trackers
summary: AirTag tracking let crooks follow this couple home â€” Don't let it happen to you!
body: TL;DR A Florida couple was subjected to a home invasion this past August. Afterwards, detectives found an AirTag secured under their car, presumably used to track them home. Android offers built-in unknown tracker detection for users interested in protecting themselves. Oh, paranoia! Everyoneâ€™s always â€œrelax, donâ€™t worry so muchâ€ until something happens to them . And if weâ€™ve got access to the tools that might prevent those bad things from happening in the first place, shouldnâ€™t we remember to be using them? Thatâ€™s exactly what weâ€™re thinking about this week, as we get an update on a scary home invasion case that appears to have involved tracking the victims via AirTag. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Samsung settles for stagnation? Galaxy S26 camera leak dashes hopes for upgrades
summary: The cameras may remained unchanged for another year.
body: Credit: Lanh Nguyen / Android Authority TL;DR A leak may have revealed a few of the specs for the base model Galaxy S26. It suggests Samsung will reuse the same camera sensors from years past. Thereâ€™s also a mention of a 4,300mAh battery and Exynos 2600 chip. Weâ€™re only a handful of months away from when Samsung usually announces its next-generation Galaxy S devices. When that time comes, weâ€™ll be excited to see what upgrades Samsung gave to the Galaxy S26 series. However, a new leak doesnâ€™t bode well if you were hoping for better cameras, at least for the base model Android flagship . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: ChatGPT could soon let you DM others using the Android app (Update: Screenshots)
summary: Following OpenAI's social pivot with the Sora app.
body: Credit: Calvin Wankhede / Android Authority TL;DR OpenAI is testing direct messaging features in ChatGPTâ€™s mobile app, along with group chats. Hints for the DM function were spotted in the code for ChatGPTâ€™s Android app. Sora, OpenAIâ€™s video generation and sharing app, already allows users to have public profiles and send DMs to others. Update: Oct 16, 2025 (09:15 AM ET): We were able to reverse engineer the latest beta build to get a glimpse of how DMs in ChatGPT could work. While itâ€™s not functional at the moment, we can see that ChatGPT lets you share individual responses as well as the entire chat with others. We also see the option to block other users. title: Google is going Bananas: Even Messages could get this viral image generation tool
summary: Nano Banana could bring smart photo editing right into your group chats.
body: Credit: Google TL;DR Google is working on adding its â€œNano Bananaâ€ AI image editing model to Google Messages. This new feature could bring AI-powered image generation to the Google Messages app. Googleâ€™s recent â€œ Nano Banana â€ update to its image editing model has been a wild success, with many praising it for its ability to retain likeness across generated images. Doubling down on its success, Google added Nano Banana to Google Searchâ€™s AI Mode and Google Lens . Weâ€™ve also spotted the company working on adding Nano Banana to Google Photos . It seems Google is on a mission to add Nano Banana to every Google app, as weâ€™ve now spotted Nano Banana references in Google Messages. title: Can you get a decent trade-in value with prepaid, or is postpaid a better deal?
summary: You can get a good trade-in value in some cases, but typically postpaid has higher trade-in values.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority If youâ€™re new to the prepaid world or considering switching from postpaid , you might wonder how trade-in values compare across the two camps. In most cases, youâ€™ll get a higher offer with postpaid trade-ins, but that doesnâ€™t mean you canâ€™t still get a good trade-in offer as a prepaid customer. Letâ€™s take a quick look at the biggest differences between prepaid and postpaid trade-ins and what to look for if you are interested in prepaid service but want a good trade-in offer. You can get a decent trade-in value, but condition matters much more with prepaid
